oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Leila Shute Tigert standing in hay field at Grassmere
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photograph of Leila Shute Tigert standing in a field, smiling, with her hat in her hand. Mary Rhea Cooper is standing behind some brush on the left. Piles of hay, fencing, and trees can be seen in the background. Written on the back is "Aunt Leila Shute Tiggart [sic]."

Mary Rhea Cooper (1911-1938) was the daughter of Amelia Townsend Tigert (1891-1928) and Ernest Bonner Cooper (1869-1951). Dr. Holland Tigert and Leila Shute Tigert, her mother's uncle and aunt, adopted Mary sometime after her parents divorced. Mary lived at Grassmere with the Tigerts until her death.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Women farmers; Family farms--Tennessee--History; Agriculture--Tennessee--History; Crops; Hay
Croplands; Fields (Agriculture)
